intro: Psychotria guaremalensis, commonly known as the Guaremalense Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are typically consumed by various bird species. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
